# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int = 10)
    result = ""
    current_line_length = 0
    for word in split(text)
        if current_line_length + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
            current_line_length = 0
        end
        result *= word
        current_line_length += length(word) + 1
    end
    return result
end
```
Example:
```
julia> wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.", 10)
"Lorem ipsu\nm dolor si\nt amet, con\nsectetur \nadipiscing \nelit."
```
